metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5175 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 53.0.2785.113 allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
